lead_paragraph: ANNS--Arlene Eiserman, of Charlottesville, Virginia, died peacefully at Westminster-Canterbury nursing center on March 28, 2016, with her husband Philip at her side. Arlene was born in Pearl River, New York on June 16, 1928 to Frederick and Ann Eiserman. She graduated from Utah State University with a BS in political science in 1950, and also attended the Wharton School for fundamentals of finance and accounting, as well as the Traphagen School of Design and Hunter College. Arlene became the first woman magazine publisher at McGraw-Hill Companies in New York City, and the first woman to receive the Advertising Representative Award in the medical field. Arlene went on to hold senior publishing appointments with many magazines such as Vice President at Morgan Grampian (a British publishing company), Aviation Week and Space Technology, Esquire, and Post Graduate Medicine and Graduating Engineer. Throughout her distinguished publishing career, Arlene received many awards for her achievements in marketing. On her retirement she was a volunteer member of the Service Corps of Retired Executives (SCORE) in Charlottesville, VA and on the Board of Directors of the National Organization on Disability. Prior to moving into the Westminster-Canterbury Senior Living Center in August 2015, Arlene and her husband Philip of thirty-eight years owned and managed Barnahill Farm in Greene County which received the 2013 Forestry Award for exceptional forestry management. Arlene is survived by her husband Philip, his daughter Jean Anns Fritchley and her husband Ron Jr., by her nephews Mark Eiserman and his wife Sharlene, Eric Eiserman and Chris Eiserman and his wife Jeanene, as well as three grandchildren and five great- grandchildren. She was predeceased by her brother Fred Eiserman. Calling hours will be held Thursday, April 28 from 6:00 until 8:00pm, at Hill & Wood Funeral Home, 201 North First Street, Charlottesville, VA. 22902. Celebration of her life services to follow on Friday, April 29 at 11:00am, St. Paul's Episcopal Church Ivy, 851 Owensville Road, Charlottesville, VA 22901. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to St. Paul's Church Ivy. Friends may send condolences to her family at www.hillandwood.com. 1/3
